title.narrative: Emergency Relief Support to River eroded people of Naria, Shariatpur (SDS)

description.narrative: The river erosion has taken a devastating turn in Shariatpur at Naria Upazila. The erosion has severely affected 10 points covering 7 Kilometers on the bank of the Padma in Shariatpur district including Naria Pourashava, Kedarpur Union, Moktarer Char Union, Nawa Para Union, Charatra Union and Gharisara union. For the last two months, the rapidly increasing erosion has totally damaged number of houses, cultivating lands, markets, roads, religious and educational institutes, electric wires and other public wealth. 10 people are dead/missing since last month due to landside in Padma. Total casualty (dead/missing) is 35 people since last two years. According to government, a total of 4200 families have been severely affected by the erosion in Naria while the local people and media say that a total of 5086 families have been affected (displaced) since last two months due to the erosion in Naria. About 27000 individuals of the affected families are suffering too much due to losing everything they had. More 8000 families are still at greater risk and vulnerable to the erosion.

"A. Christian Aid and consortium partners will target the most affected communities based on pre-defined selection criteria. Full care will be taken to involve the local communities in the identification of those who are most vulnerable and confirm selection criteria. Primary targets will include families who have so far not received adequate humanitarian assistance from government response and other humanitarian agencies. B. Christian Aid and consortium partners will target extremely marginalised, poor and socially excluded communities who are severely affected by the erosion and have lost their food stocks, houses, and other household belongings. C. Following this targeted approach, 80% of beneficiaries will be from marginalised communities and the remainder will be other vulnerable people in the target area. We will also address the intersectionality of various groups e.g. priority will be given to single women, persons with disabilities, the elderly and other excluded communities
